credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Design for an altar
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
description: Vertical rectangle. Shown are the elevation, an unfinished plan, a finished plan in a smaller scale. The mensa stands in front of a dado which ends laterally with two round pedestals with statues. In front of the dado of the retable stands the tabernacle in the centere. The retable has a half-circular shape formed by a double colonnade. It has on top a conch and a triangular pediment. On top a cross between two angels. The Ascension of the Virgin is represented by sculputred figures. Measurements are indicated beside the elevation and in the plans. On the smaller plan are also letters which are explained by a caption: "A) Anacroteri p[er le] statue/ B Pilastri." Accounts are below at right; written in the upper left corner is : "N 11" (erased) "69". Colored background.
name: Drawing
